text: BanjoZine: the underground intersection of games, philosophy, and media. Established in March 2021, this digital cryptex delves into pop culture revelations, the arcane secrets of game design, and the abyss of philosophical discourse. As nightfall descends, embark on an unexpected odyssey.

Do you yearn for a deeper connection with the unseen forces of BanjoZine? The ancient pact of Patreon awaits! Gazing into the dark crystal pool of previews, patrons scry pages of upcoming issues, while those of higher ranks can manifest physical copies into existence. Through support and shared energies, patrons become essential conduits of creation, fanning our ever-burning black flame, and propelling our nocturnal journey further into the unknown.
title: BanjoZine

text: I started making maps for DOOM II in December of 2019, looking for a convenient way to start dabbling in 3D level design. I have a lot of nostalgia for DOOM too having installed it on all of the school PCs that I used when I was a student. You will need a copy of DOOM2.wad and a source port to be able to play my levels.
title: BanjoDOOM

media.alt: Demon hordes on the ashen plains

tagline: An expansive magma shoreline with hordes of modded enemies
text: I created this map to teach myself the basics of DECORATE and UDMF. It is a remake of the very beginning of my first proper map MALAGARD. Initially I was going to remake the entirety of MALAGARD in this style but ran into some issues. I designed this map to be a humungous space to explore but it quickly became too big and the node builder began to express unusual buggy sector behaviour and I had to cut the map short. I'm not sure the modifications I made to the player and enemies have entirely worked out but the map remains an interesting and unique experience.
title: Blazing Beachhead

media.alt: DOOM II Deep Underground Military Bunker by BanjoDave

tagline: A strange mist is making people crazy in this secret base, and your prison door just unlocked itself
text: Uses only dynamic lightning. This map was MAP01 of MALAGARD 2 before I decided to remake it. Uses Tango's Supercharge gameplay mod as a base.
title: Deep Underground Military Bunker

tagline: Climb storm-lashed cliffs on your way to a monumental fortress in this collab with Danlex
text: Come eat the Mapwich! Mappers are randomly assigned into pairs to collaborate on a map utilising ukiro's beautiful texture pack OTEX and Tango's Supercharge gameplay mod.

Danlex and I created this towering map for MAP11 in Mapwich 2. Starting on the beach you must discover a way to progress up the cliffside. Emerging from a cave you will discover a huge white and gold palace jutting out from the sea. Forge a path over the precarious cliffside and prepare yourself to battle atop the the palace.
title: Mapwich 2: Ascent to Valhalla

tagline: A pac-man type character re-imagined as a planet killer
text: This was from when I first got DALL·E access.
title: Planet Killer

media.alt: The view from atop Blood Keep

tagline: Navigate the mysterious ruins and bulwarks on a demon-infested island
text: I've been making maps for 2D games for a while but I thought it was time to expand into Doom. I started learning how to use doom builder late October and am proud to release my first map! This is a 45-50 minute map that only works in GZDoom as far as I know. Uses stock Doom II textures. Difficulty levels available. Jump and crouch disabled. Mouselook optional. Save points are built in to the map so making your own saves is cheating.

I tried to keep this map very classic in style, so no slopes or dynamic lights etc were used. I did have to use 3d floors for ceilings in places but that was more due to being naive about sectors and how the sky worked. If I were to remake this I would probably include more void sectors to improve performance. That being said, one of my favourite things about the map is the long lines of sight and being able to see parts of the map that are coming up next. I'm looking forward to making more maps in the future. I had a lot of fun making this so I hope you enjoy playing and let me know what you think!
Special thanks to Bridgeburner's The Hellforge for answering my questions and providing a place to hang out. Thanks to the tutorials on DragonFly's website. Thanks to Major Arlene for playtesting.
title: MALAGARD

tagline: Play as the great serpent Nidhogg who chews the roots of Yggdrasil until Ragnarok
text: Made for Global Game Jam 2023 (the theme was "roots") at an in-person event in Dundee. Very glad to have gotten out of my comfort zone to attend. Make sure the roots don't manage to tap the wells of energy, while also consuming the souls of sinners to preserve your health.
Team: Me (Programming), with Ewan Gowans (Sound Effects), Alastair Low (Art Assets), Michael Shaw (Music).
title: Malice Striker

text: Nominated for the 2007 Dronie Awards for Most Innovative Use of Objects or Tiles. I was experimenting with the order in which objects are layered, and found that sandwiching a thwump between a zap or chaingun drone and a laser drone gave an interesting effect.

text: "This map was a major influence on me back in the day. It's pretentious as fuck and not really very well put together, probably (it's been aaaaaaaaaaaaaages since I've played it; this review is only happening because flag sucks large fat penis), but fuck if I didn't love that back then. In fact, this map was the direct inspiration for a specific map of mine, made for a Halloween comp a couple years back. See if you can find it!
"Also, ghosts or something. Peace." — gloomp
title: ###d###

text: "I love DW40 maps. He sees N in a very different way to me. His heavily object-based mapping allows him to see potential in empty spaces, and create deeply interesting and enjoyable structures in ways nobody else does.

"The top section of this map serves as a prime example of this. Creative, challenging, complex, and unique - this map was the first in a long time to make me stop and actually think "How do I do this?"." — _destiny^-
title: XO

buttons.label: Download N v1.4 for PC (n_v1pc.zip) 1.26 MB

text: In N by Metanet Software, you step into the agile shoes of a ninja, gifted with unparalleled speed, dexterity, and a lifespan of 1.5 minutes. Your world is a universe governed by physics, where momentum is your ally and trajectory your guiding star. Amidst your fleeting existence, you are called upon to navigate through rooms teeming with lethal robotic adversaries and an array of hazards, while always seeking the allure of gold.

The heart of N beats in its vibrant community, where disciples of the game exercise their creativity in crafting and sharing custom maps to NUMA. These user-generated levels add a spectrum of novel challenges, turning this platformer into an ever-evolving digital playground where each new map is a testament to the collective creativity and ingenuity of its players.
The maps on this website and on NUMA are designed for version 1.4 of the game, released in 2005. You can find a free download of this version below.
title: N

buttons.label: Download game pre-packaged with levels [DW40_rootootoot.rar 1.27 MB]

tagline: 500 maps by DW40 for N v1.4
text: In 2018, I set out on the monumental task of compiling every map I've ever crafted. From this extensive collection, I painstakingly curated my top 500 - a showcase of my best work. These maps were then meticulously structured into an episodic format matching the original game reflecting a progression in both difficulty and complexity.
title: rootootoot complete

tagline: Played like two handed rock-paper-scissors, a game invented at Melee invitational Shoot the Gun
text: When deciding which movie to watch in the big lounge at STG3, everyone put their suggestions on Discord to a vote with heart reacts. Jude started reacting with gun emojis to mark go-to-bed worthy suggestions. From elsewhere in the building this activity was noticed by a watchful Zeppo, fingers ready to introduce the chicken react, an inscrutable omen, to the mix...

tagline: I tried streaming and content creation
text: In 2017 I tried my hand at streaming regularly on Twitch. I also edited these streams for upload to YouTube. I didn't really have the right skillset for streaming at the time, and looking back, it's not good content. F to C- grade stuff. From these videos you can expect a lot of mumbling, muted reactions, long silences, and honestly just sh*te patter as I beat some old games, and try to get some highscores. Thanks to everyone who supported me on Twitch and Discord at this time, when I had moved into my first non-student flat, trying to land a steady job in a new city.
title: Cringe Archive 2017

text: Theme: Projectile hell (only projectile throwing monsters) and Weapon slot 9 - Barrels.

I based the theme of this map on the fireblu texture dividing it into two sides, one red and one blue. Starting in the blue side, you will face imps, hell knighs, and cacodemons with your shotgun and chaingun. After passing through the white and fireblu portal room and getting your plasma rifle and rocket launcher, you will enter the red side which is filled with barons, arachnotrons, revenants and cyberdemons.
title: DireFlu

text: One of the oldest computer files I have dates back to 2005. A friend of mine discovered that if you adjust the size of an image in a certain way, you can create all kinds of intriguing visual effects. I have to agree with him, it's quite true. This particular file from 2005, a simple copy and paste job, seems to naturally fit into the concept of a 3D Holo-Card. It reveals a fascinating pattern as it undergoes the transformation.
title: Optical Illusion

text: After a showing of Total Recall (1990), we were asked to leave the theatre by the fire exit. Outside, at some point during the film and entirely unbeknownst to us, a fire had started nearby at the Glasgow School of Art and was blazing by the time we exited. Apparently, failure to address concerns raised by a smaller fire four years prior allowed this incident, the cause of which was never determined, to rip through most of the building and damage the neighbouring concert venue. Big shout out to the emergency services, and apologies for making light of this tragic cultural loss which displaced local residents, but it was quite exciting at the time.
title: Total Recall & The GSoA Fire

text: From YoYo Games Archive: "Changes in version 1.02
. Game UI is now designed to be predominantly controled by controlers
. Real time character select
. The first ammo mechanic
. Randomised themed music now impliemnted into the the 3 stages
. Slightly updated instructions !
. Character changes for
A.)Hopperspace- fixed a bug regarding gravity
B.)Cajonja - teleport now only costs 2 ammo
- Button 2 is now a new move the "bullet drop"
c.)Gyah - left/right spray now only costs 1 ammo

title: musicstuffsome - ASCI kicking warriors

text: From YoYo Games Archive: "Top down shooter I am working on. Also my first GM game. Music by SabrePulse. Controls: Z-shoot, arrows-move, M-mute, SPACE-pause."
My apologies for using this song, and some art assets, without permission.
title: Bulletbullet

text: I played VAL for 3 months before I had to uninstall it when I started playing it during the time I had blocked out for studying. Anyway I mostly played Deathmatch and Spike Rush, and hadn't played a PC shooter other than DOOM and HEXEN before this, so expect bullshit instead of godlike plays here. I can't believe how much I spent on skins and I still get the urge to re-download.
title: Valorant Clips
